channel.title: Arios 498 - [Reliving The Good Times]
channel.description:
[CENTER][IMG]http://ariosrsps.com/arix/images/logo.png[/img]
Arios is a real 498 old-school project that began in [U]October 2012[/U]. It aims at emulating pre-HD RuneScape. The server is build from scratch, using NIO for networking and plugin-based development for action content (button actions, object actions, NPC actions, etc.). The client and cache are 498.
[u][b]Developers[/b][/u] Emperor (Game developer) Vexia (Game developer) Stacx (Game developer)
[u][b]Progress[/b][/u] [B]The progress below has been categorized and condensed.[/B] [B]For a long list of progress browse through the multiple pages.[/B]
- All Free To Play areas have been emulated in reference to runescape. - All Free To Play skills have also been emulated including all methods of the skill. - Game related functions such as clan chat, private chat, assist system, report system and trading have been implemented. - Various Free To Play and Member content pieces have been implemented such as Falador Drop Party Room, Tutorial Island(2007), Clue scroll system, grave stones, random events, quests(all f2p), traveling(ships, gliders..etc), free to play minigames, and many more endless pieces of emulated content.
[B]The majority of miscellaneous content has been posted in the following pages of this thread if you would like a wider look on content and progress.[/B]
[u][b]Media[/b][/u] [img]http://puu.sh/4l178.png[/img] [IMG]http://puu.sh/4Kvjr.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://puu.sh/4MY4l.png[/img] [IMG]http://puu.sh/4KvLM.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://puu.sh/4KvRt.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://puu.sh/4KvU2.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://puu.sh/4KvX0.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://puu.sh/4Kw2R.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://puu.sh/4Kw5v.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://puu.sh/4KwaF.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://puu.sh/4Kwec.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://puu.sh/4Kwfl.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://puu.sh/4Kwid.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://puu.sh/4Kwmf.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://puu.sh/4KwoF.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://puu.sh/4KwtW.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://puu.sh/4KwvB.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://puu.sh/4KwAw.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://puu.sh/4KwBA.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://puu.sh/4KwD2.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://puu.sh/4KwHf.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://puu.sh/4KwNV.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://puu.sh/4KwPs.jpg[/img] [img]http://i.imgur.com/Uqg2kC4.png[/img] [img]http://i.imgur.com/3ceFapj.png[/img] [img]http://i.imgur.com/HvZF7yK.png[/img] [B]View the pages on the thread for the full amount of media.[/B]
Project thread created by a Vexia[/CENTER]

item.title: Arios 498 - [Reliving The Good Times]
item.dc:creator: @I_Pk_22 I Pk 22
item.description:
@I_Pk_22 wrote:

Jealousy at it’s finest form. This is crystallized by envious little bastards who cannot control their inner motions and hence proceed to inflict unnecessary damage on such a poignantly constructed server.

:palm:

I really enjoy playing Arios, and I honestly hope to god these attacks are prevented and issues like these are rectified. Arios is by far one of the best standout of all RuneScape remakes (in respect to the 2008 pre-HD era), and I’m sure that the majority of people (aside from jealous arseholes who have no skill themselves) would agree with me.

Cheers, and hopefully this gets fixed.

Read full topic

item.title: Arios 498 - [Reliving The Good Times]
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:591, topic:475806”][quote author=ox random xi link=topic=593939.msg4431255#msg4431255 date=1403314467]

Looks like the website is down advertising another server, I guess I was right when I said this would die before 6 months online

Doesn’t seem like the kind of thing Adam would do, might not be anything legit. The text-voice conversion is incredible tacky, he wasn’t the kind of guy to do retard shit like that when I knew him.

I wouldn’t settle for it being down for long, they spent far to long on this to let it go like this.
[/quote]and if it’s not legit, second web attack within 2 months? Someone doesn’t believe in this server, and it seems to be working.

These things happen, if it’s Anthony who done their site I’m surprised at web attacks although I’m not sure who actually completed their site so I can’t confirm that. It’ll bounce back, people just need to believe.[/quote]

I’m going to clear up some confusion since my name has been mentioned now:

I did the original integration work on Arios which involved designing the Player Portal (PP) and integrating with their SMF forums before the release was made. I got about 90% of the way there on the night before the release but there were critical bugs that needed to be fixed and the security of the portal still had to be reviewed (it hadn’t undergone extensive testing just yet because the actual integration had almost been completed). I recommended stalling the release date if they wanted the PP actually functional – they didn’t want to and I understand that they wanted to keep true to their release date so I reverted my integration hooks and went to bed before everyone else because I had work. That morning I found out there was an attack but also learned the PP wasn’t disabled. This is most likely the reason for attack #1 but we never looked into exactly what it was.

I haven’t worked with Arios for probably a month now so I cannot explain attack #2 or any changes that have been made since the new web developer has taken over. All I know is that a site re-design has been going on so that might be the reason for the attack.

Read full topic

Doesn’t seem like the kind of thing Adam would do, might not be anything legit. The text-voice conversion is incredible tacky, he wasn’t the kind of guy to do retard shit like that when I knew him.

I wouldn’t settle for it being down for long, they spent far to long on this to let it go like this.
[/quote]and if it’s not legit, second web attack within 2 months? Someone doesn’t believe in this server, and it seems to be working.[/quote]
These things happen, if it’s Anthony who done their site I’m surprised at web attacks although I’m not sure who actually completed their site so I can’t confirm that. It’ll bounce back, people just need to believe.

item.title: Arios 498 - [Reliving The Good Times]
item.dc:creator: @prothieum prothieum
item.description:
@prothieum wrote:

  • Added the Lost City of Zanaris quest.
  • Access to Zanaris is added.
  • Ability to wield dragon longswords & dragon daggers.
  • Payment of a cut diamond will be needed in order to access the market area.
  • The marker area contains Jukat whom sells dragon swords.
    *Note Zanaris isn’t fully complete.
